62.title: Patsy Pinup
62.author: by Wanda Graham
notes: Summary: Patsy saves an artist from a lynch mob, and gets her portrait painted in exchange. Unfortunately (to Patsy's way of thinking) he's an abstract artist.

63.title: Patsy Pinup
63.author: by Wanda Graham
63.series: Apr. 1947) "He Saw Through Me All The Time!"*
notes: Summary: Patsy rescues negatives from a burning building to save her career, and when they're printed discovers they were x-rays.

139.heading: Patsy Walker.
139.title: Girls' Life.

140.title: Patsy Manners
notes: Etiquette feature in Treasure Chest of Fun & Fact. The art is mostly credited to Ozella Welch. Other credited names are D. Willson, Alvena Burnite (as writer), and C. Eileen Fiel or "Aunt Eileen" (as writer)
